skill.name: perigon-agent
skill.description: Pointers for Copilot/agents to apply Perigon conventions
skill.summary: Pointers for Copilot/agents to apply Perigon conventions
skill.author: AterDev

security_audit.summary: Pure documentation skill containing only project conventions and directory structure references. No executable code, no network calls, no file system access beyond its own markdown file. This is a safe, prompt-based knowledge resource for AI coding assistants.

content.value_statement: AI coding assistants often lack context about project structure and coding standards. This skill provides clear conventions and directory mappings so agents generate accurate, consistent code that matches your codebase patterns.
actual_capabilities: Maps backend directory structure for Entity, Service, and Controller locations
Maps frontend Angular directory structure for routes, services, and components
Provides coding convention defaults (RESTful APIs, EF patterns, error handling)
Links to Perigon documentation for detailed guidelines
Guides AI agents on when to ask for clarification vs assume
Sets accuracy-first behavior for code generation
limitations: Does not execute code or modify files
Does not access project files or run builds
Does not integrate with external APIs or services
Does not provide runtime debugging or diagnostics

use_cases.title: Maintain code consistency
use_cases.description: Ensure AI-generated code follows your team conventions across backend and frontend modules.

use_cases.title: Understand project context
use_cases.description: Get clear directory mappings and conventions before generating code for a Perigon project.

use_cases.title: Enforce architecture patterns
use_cases.description: Provide AI agents with project-specific rules like ManagerBase pattern and Code First EF conventions.

prompt_templates.title: Generate new service
prompt_templates.scenario: Creating backend service with correct structure
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a new UserManager and UserController in the User module following Perigon conventions. Use ManagerBase pattern and RESTful APIs with Guid v7 IDs.

prompt_templates.title: Add Angular feature
prompt_templates.prompt: Add a new dashboard route in the Angular app. Create the route definition, service, and shared component following Perigon frontend conventions.

prompt_templates.title: Implement data access
prompt_templates.prompt: Add a new Product entity with related DTOs. Use Code First EF pattern and select projections. Follow Perigon naming conventions.

prompt_templates.title: Handle errors properly
prompt_templates.prompt: Add proper error handling to the OrderService using BusinessException and ProblemDetails format. Avoid manager cross-calls.

output_examples.input: Create a new API endpoint for getting user profile in the User module
output: I will create the endpoint in the correct location following Perigon conventions:
‚Ä¢ Return ProblemDetails on errors, not ApiResponse wrappers

best_practices: Reference this skill at the start of coding tasks to ensure AI agents follow project conventions
Combine with your .github/copilot-instructions.md for global rules and accuracy-first behavior
Update the skill when project structure or conventions change to keep AI context current
anti_patterns: Using AI to generate code without this context, leading to mismatched file locations and inconsistent patterns
Assuming AI knows your project structure without providing directory mappings
Ignoring the guidance to ask for clarification when entity details are unclear

faq.question: Which AI tools support this skill?
faq.answer: Compatible with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code. Works as a knowledge base for any AI coding assistant.

faq.question: What project conventions does this skill cover?
faq.answer: RESTful APIs, ManagerBase pattern, Code First EF, Guid v7 IDs, BusinessException errors, and select projections.

faq.question: How does this integrate with my project?
faq.answer: Add as a reference skill. AI agents read it for directory mappings and conventions before generating code.

faq.question: Is my project data safe with this skill?
faq.answer: Yes. This skill only provides read-only conventions. It does not access, read, or modify any project files.

faq.question: What if my project structure differs?
faq.answer: Customize the skill to match your actual directory layout. The skill is a template for project-specific conventions.

faq.question: How is this different from .github/copilot-instructions.md?
faq.answer: Global rules go in copilot-instructions.md. This skill provides project-specific structure and coding conventions.
